ETYMOLOGY: From French gramme, from Late Latin gramma 'a small weight, a scruple', from Ancient Greek grámma (γράμμα) 'small weight', literally 'that which is written, a letter', from gráphein (γράφειν) 'to write'. The modern metric unit sense was adopted in France in 1795.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A metric unit of mass, equal to one thousandth of a kilogram (approximately 0.035 ounces).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 克，公克 (国际单位制中质量单位，等于千分之一千克，约合0.035盎司)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The recipe calls for 200 grams of flour.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An informal term for a gram of cannabis, especially when sold.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He paid $20 for a gram of weed.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他花20美元买了一克大麻。

REGISTER: Neutral to Technical (for unit of mass); Informal (for cannabis slang)
